intro: Phlegmariurus durus, commonly known as the tough clubmoss, is a species of moss that belongs to the family Lepidoziaceae. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and dark green to brownish coloration. The plant forms mats or cushions, often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its sporophytes are typically short and stout, with a single spore capsule at the tip. Phlegmariurus durus is adapted to thrive in humid climates and plays a role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats.
